page.title: 12A SURVEY OF LOCAL HOUSES
page.content: We did a survey of the houses of the children in the junior classes. We wanted to find out what they were built of, what the roof was made of, and how old they were. 35 replies were received. Many of the replies said that their houses were built of more than one material, but we were still surprised that only 42% were made of brick. A third contained stone, and a third are made at least partly of cob. 15% were made of concrete blocks and 6% of wood. We found that 45% of the houses were roofed with slate, 42% with tiles, and only 13% thatched. We thought more of the cob houses would have had thatched roofs. We found 26% had been built since 1970, 24% built before 1750, and the rest evenly spread between.
